str2: A primary particle; but, and, etc.
Joseph, a proper name. Of Hebrew origin; Joseph, the name of seven Israelites.
From, away from. A primary particle; 'off, ' i.e. Away, in various senses.
Arimathea, a place in Palestine. Of Hebrew origin; Arimathaea, a place in Palestine.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
A learner, disciple, pupil. From manthano; a learner, i.e. Pupil.
Of Hebrew origin; Jesus, the name of our Lord and two other Israelites.
A primary particle; but, and, etc.

parse: Verb - Perfect Participle Middle or Passive - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: To hide, conceal, lay up. A primary verb; to conceal.
A primary preposition denoting the channel of an act; through.
(a) fear, terror, alarm, (b) the object or cause of fear, (c) reverence, respect. From a primary phebomai; alarm or fright.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Jewish. From Iouda; Judaean, i.e. Belonging to Jehudah.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: Apparently from ereo; to interrogate; by implication, to request.
Pilate. Of Latin origin; close-pressed, i.e. Firm; Pilatus, a Roman.
In order that, so that. Probably from the same as the former part of heautou; in order that.

parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To raise, lift up, take away, remove.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Body, flesh; the body of the Church. From sozo; the body, used in a very wide application, literally or figuratively.
Of Hebrew origin; Jesus, the name of our Lord and two other Israelites.
Pilate. Of Latin origin; close-pressed, i.e. Firm; Pilatus, a Roman.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To turn to, commit, entrust; I allow, yield, permit. From epi and the base of trope; to turn over, i.e. Allow.
Therefore, then. Apparently a primary word; certainly, or accordingly.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To come, go.
And, even, also, namely.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To raise, lift up, take away, remove.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
Body, flesh; the body of the Church. From sozo; the body, used in a very wide application, literally or figuratively.
